intro: Chorizanthe angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf jointvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, angular stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small, greenish or reddish flowers that are often arranged in dense clusters. Chorizanthe angustifolia is an annual plant that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native range.
